result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha V. BIES was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use/Unauth Person FS (>$100-5000/1st), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 49.795(6).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Holly Taddy.

Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Stipulation and Order Granting Furlough
The court orders that Defendant is granted a furlough from the sentences imposed in the above-captioned cases begining at 8:00 a.m. on June 15, 2016 and concluding at 8:30 a.m. on June 20, 2016. Upon conclusion of the furlough, defendant will report to the electronic monitoring program representative in Sheboygan.
Copy to Jail.

Letter from Michael & Connie Krebsbach to the Court.
Cover letter

State files an Amended Information charging Food Stamp Fraud, contrary to Section 49.795(6)&(8)(a)2 of the Wisconsin Statutes.   Motion granted.   No contest plea to the amended charge.   Convicted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Sentencing hearing is set for 02-26-16 at 9:30 a.m.   Report to be filed by 02-15-16.  Court orders defendant to submit DNA sample.   Court orders defendant's bail revoked.
